title: 112_hr3172
content: The Act may be cited as the "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" and focuses on protecting at-risk youth under Medicaid. The "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" amends Section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act to ensure that eligible juveniles do not lose medical assistance while in a public institution, with a process to prevent claiming Federal financial participation during that period. The "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" amends Section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act to ensure eligible juveniles in public institutions receive necessary medical assistance without losing Federal financial participation. The "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" ensures that eligible juveniles in public institutions receive medical assistance upon release without losing Federal financial participation. Eligible juveniles are individuals aged 21 or younger. The "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" guarantees medical assistance for juveniles aged 21 or younger in public institutions upon release, without losing Federal financial support. The amendments made by the "At-Risk Youth Medicaid Protection Act" will take effect 6 months after enactment and apply to eligibility and enrollment. State plans requiring legislation to meet the new requirements will not be penalized solely for failing to meet them. The Act requires states to meet additional requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter following the first regular session of the State legislature after the Act's enactment. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session.
